title: Matchsafe, "Face with Extended Tongue", late 19th century
markings: STERLING 153 stamped on outside beneath chin.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Oval, in the form of a face with eyes looking upward and crossed, furrowed brow, wide open grin, and tongue extended out and down over chin. No ornament on reverse. Area from top of head down to continuous eye brow line is lid, hinged on upper left side. Ridged tongue likely intended as striker.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Face with Extended Tongue", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-955.
